member.summary: A value indicating whether this is inactive.

member.name: T:PostmarkDotNet.PostmarkAdminClient
member.summary: Postmark Client that supports access to the Administrative APIs, to send email, use the PostmarkClient, instead.
member.remarks: Make sure to include "using PostmarkDotNet;" in your class file, which will include extension methods on the base client.

member.name: M:PostmarkDotNet.PCL.PostmarkClientBase.#ctor(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Provides a base implementation of core request/response interactions.

member.name: M:PostmarkDotNet.PCL.PostmarkClientBase.ProcessRequestAsync``2(System.String,System.Net.Http.HttpMethod,``0)
member.summary: The core delivery method for all other API methods.

member.name: M:PostmarkDotNet.PCL.PostmarkClientBase.ProcessNoBodyRequestAsync``1(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.Object},System.Net.Http.HttpMethod)
member.summary: Core implementation of HTTP interaction for "no body" requests (i.e. GET/DELETE)

member.name: P:PostmarkDotNet.PCL.PostmarkClientBase.ClientFactory
member.summary: Configure a global connection factory to to process HTTP interactions.
member.remarks: In most cases, you should not need to modify this property, but it's useful in cases where you want to use another http client, or to mock the http processing (for tests).

member.name: M:PostmarkDotNet.PostmarkAdminClient.#ctor(System.String,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Construct a PostmarkAdminClient.
member.param: The "accountToken" can be found by logging into your Postmark and navigating to https://postmarkapp.com/account/edit - Keep this token secret and safe.
The number of seconds to wait for the API to return before throwing a timeout exception.
Optionally override the base url to the API. For example, you may fallback to HTTP (non-SSL) if your app requires it, though, this is not recommended.

member.name: M:PostmarkDotNet.PostmarkAdminClient.GetServerAsync(System.Int32)
member.summary: Get a server with the associated serverId.

member.name: M:PostmarkDotNet.PostmarkAdminClient.DeleteServerAsync(System.Int32)
member.summary: Get a server with the associated serverId.
member.remarks: To protected your account, you must first request access to use this endpont from support@postmarkapp.com

member.summary: Create a new Server.
Update a Server.

member.name: M:PostmarkDotNet.PostmarkAdminClient.GetSenderSignaturesAsync(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Get a specific sender signature.

member.summary: Retrieve a sender signature.

member.name: M:PostmarkDotNet.PostmarkAdminClient.DeleteSignatureAsync(System.Int32)
member.summary: Delete a sender signature.

member.name: M:PostmarkDotNet.PostmarkAdminClient.ResendSignatureVerificationEmailAsync(System.Int32)
member.summary: Cause a new sender signature verification email to be sent to the associated email address.

member.name: M:PostmarkDotNet.PostmarkAdminClient.RequestNewSignatureDKIMAsync(System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a new DKIM key to be created. Until the DNS entries are confirmed, the new values will be in the DKIMPendingHost and DKIMPendingTextValue fields. After the new DKIM value is verified in DNS, the pending values will migrate to DKIMTextValue and DKIMPendingTextValue and Postmark will begin to sign emails with the new DKIM key.

member.name: M:PostmarkDotNet.PostmarkAdminClient.VerifySignatureSPF(System.Int32)
member.summary: Will query DNS for your domain and attempt to verify the SPF record contains the information for Postmark's servers.

member.name: M:PostmarkDotNet.PostmarkAdminClient.CreateSignatureAsync(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Create a new sender signature. Note that you'll need to verify this by clicking on the verification link sent to the associated email address.

member.name: M:PostmarkDotNet.PostmarkAdminClient.UpdateSignatureAsync(System.Int32,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Modift an existing sender signature.

member.name: M:PostmarkDotNet.PostmarkAdminClient.GetServersAsync(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: List all servers that are currently configured for this account.

member.name: P:PostmarkDotNet.PostmarkAdminClient.AuthHeaderName
member.summary: The authentication header required for Admin API interactions, in this case: "X-Postmark-Account-Token"

member.name: T:PostmarkDotNet.PostmarkClient
member.summary: The standard Postmark API, allows all interactions with a Postmark "Server" (send/recieve/process/analyze emails). This client supports normal API interactions, for Administrative API interactions, use the PostmarkAdminClient.
member.remarks: Make sure to include "using PostmarkDotNet;" in your class file, which will include extension methods on the base client.

member.name: M:PostmarkDotNet.PostmarkClient.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Instantiate the client.
member.param: Used for requests that require server level privileges. This token can be found on the Credentials tab under your Postmark server.

member.name: M:PostmarkDotNet.PostmarkClient.SendMessageAsync(PostmarkDotNet.PostmarkMessage)
member.summary: Sends a message through the Postmark API. All email addresses must be valid, and the sender must be a valid sender signature according to Postmark. To obtain a valid sender signature, log in to Postmark and navigate to: http://postmarkapp.com/signatures.
member.param: A prepared message.

member.name: M:PostmarkDotNet.PostmarkClient.SendMessagesAsync(PostmarkDotNet.PostmarkMessage[])
member.summary: Sends a batch of up to 500 messages through the Postmark API. All email addresses must be valid, and the sender must be a valid sender signature according to Postmark. To obtain a valid sender signature, log in to Postmark and navigate to: http://postmarkapp.com/signatures.
member.param: A prepared batch of messages.
member.returns: The processed messages (Complete with system assigned message IDs)

member.summary: Retrieves the bounce-related results for the associated mail server.

member.summary: Retrieves a collection of instances along with a sum total of bounces recorded by the server, based on filter parameters.
member.param: The type of bounces to filter on.
Whether to return only inactive or active bounces; use null to return all bounces.
Filters based on whether the filter value is contained in the bounce source's email.
Filters on the bounce tag.
Filter by MessageID.
The page offset for the returned results; defaults to 0.
The number of results to return by the page offset; defaults to 100.

member.summary: Retrieves a single based on a specified ID.
member.param: The bounce ID of the bounce to retrieve.

member.summary: Returns the raw source of the bounce we accepted. If Postmark does not have a dump for that bounce, it will return an empty string.
member.param: The bounce ID of the bounce dump to retrieve.
